content: We have tags in the issue tracker for some features, such as F-non_exhaustive that have been stabilised since. Should we be actively removing tags for stabilized features?
The problem with that is then it will be harder to go back and find those issues. Maybe we rename them somehow instead?
yeah, I saw an issue and figured I'd add an F- tag to it, but then spent 20 minutes pondering if I should given the feature is stable already
How about for now once a feature is stable, we rename it to Fstable-{feature-name} or something like that, to make it clear that it is a stable feature?
We kinda have A- for that I think.
renaming F-feature to A-feature when stabilized sounds good to me
and if there's both, just delete F-feature (maybe with automation to be sure A-feature gets added if not present)
We could also just change the description from #![feature(...)] to something else.
Whatever we choose to change the label name/description to, I don't think we should delete feature labels
